Key Match Events: Shaedon Sharpe's put-back slam dunk with 5:26 left in the game put Portland up 91-83, sending the home crowd into a frenzy.
Pre-Game Insights: The Blazers were without starting point guard Anfernee Simons, who left Tuesdayâ€™s game with shortness of breath.
The Wolves played without starting point guard Mike Conley.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Portland extended its lead to double digits for the first time on free throws by Sharpe to make it 89-78.
Minnesota shot 7 for 39 (18%) from the 3-point line.
Others: The teams entered the fourth quarter tied before Portland took control behind the defense of Clingan, who had four blocks in the period as Minnesota missed 10 of its first 11 shots to start the final frame.
